author: ineedthreefiddy
body: I sold out not too long ago with my TXN, i have 4months but that doesn't mean keep it for that long always. I managed to hold overnight for a 60% gain, why keep and potentially lose. Rather pull out and go to the next one.  Trust me i love gambling .. But i love money and winning more lol i already have my next position. Also, i dont buy 20 different companies at once. I only buy 1 and play it and once im finished i am out and put majority of my cash to the next. Easier for me to keep a eye on haha.

author: adyuma
body:
Does questrade charge any conversion fees when you purchase US equities? 
Having that problem with my Wealthsimple account, they market as free buying and selling US equities but they charge a whopping 1.5% per txn as conversion fees!

author: MiddleC5

author: snake250
body:
Your list has some good ones. I like T and QCOM (if you go QCOM, consider diversifying to AVGO and TXN as well). If you include ETFs, consider VPU. Here are some other suggestions:

MO

Closest thing to a cash printing machine there is. Payout ratio is not high (< 80%) for this type of a stock. 50 years of dividend increases. People have been saying it's a dying business for 30 years. COVID "safe".

WFC, BAC, JPM or KRE

Bank dividends are a hot topic right now, not denying there's some risk, worth researching and watching (if you can get them cheap, might be worth it even in the unlikely case that dividends are temporarily disrupted because in the long run they don't have much else to do but to return profits to shareholders). For other financials, check out PRU, BEN (study risks). Maybe also MET and AFL.

CVS, WBA, BMY, PFE

Safety here, especially amid COVID-19.

CSCO

Not now, but when yield is closer to 4%.

OKE

More risk (but less than the REITs IMHO), high payout ratio, worth researching and watching.

author: adyuma
body:
Hey bro, thanks for the info. I was researching on this further and it seems Wealthsimple does not support holding USD currency in my account, therefore norberts gambit wouldnt work there as once I sell the USD ETF it will convert back to CAD. Conversion fee is the only way they make money so it seems accurate that they wouldnt allow this.

Seems like the best bet for me would be to transfer over to Questrade and then use norberts gambit to convert into USD. I would have to pay the $4.95-$9.95 commission per txn but this is faaar better off than the 3% conversion fee!

Thank you!
